citation.article-title: Phenetic diversity of alkaliphilic Bacillus strains: proposal for nine new species.

p.s: This description is based on the strains of DNA hybridization group 10 of this study. Colonies are white, circular, smooth and shining, sometimes with a darker centre. Cells are rod-shaped (0.5-0.7 X 3.0-5.0 μm), producing ellipsoidal endospores (0.5-0.7 x 0.9-1.3 μm) which are located subterminally and do not swell the sporangium. Strains of this species hydrolyse casein, gelatin, pullulan, starch, Tween 40 and Tween 60. They do not hydrolyse hippurate, MUG or Tween 20 (strain PN-138 is weakly positive). Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite (strain PN-101 is an exception) and strains do not deaminate phenylalanine. No growth is observed at pH 7.0; the optimum is about pH 10 (pH 9·0 for strain PN-57). The temperature range for growth is 10-40 °C. There is a variable reaction to NaCl: the type strain and strain PN-S7 are sensitive to 5 % NaCl but other strains tolerate 8 % NaCl. Carbon source utilization profiles showed that strains use L-arabinose, melibiose and rhamnose for growth. The chromosomal DNA base composition is 36.2-38.4 mol % G+C.
